name: Dominic D'Ellsadro

topics.topic_text: Where do the caravans set up?
topics.response_text: You can find them out front. If you didn't see them coming in, that probably means they're all out on trips.

topics.topic_text: That's all I need to know.
Where can I get some food?
topics.response_text: Go talk with Porter, over in the Diner. He'll set you right for food.

topics.topic_text: Can I get some directions around town?
topics.response_text: No problem. What're you looking for?

topics.topic_text: No worries. I wasn't planning on stealing anything.
topics.response_text: Sounds like a good plan. Keeps the traders happy, that way. And it means Machete and I get to save on ammo.

topics.topic_text: Do you personally threaten every visitor to your town?
topics.response_text: When I can find time for it, sure. In the guarding business, it's the personal touches that make all the difference.

topics.topic_text: Maybe I can introduce a new pastime: shooting nosy guards in the face.
topics.response_text: Sure, you do that. We can take turns shooting each other, teams are "the whole damned town" versus "your face." Our team's got a winning record.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Canterbury Commons?
topics.response_text: Canterbury's a good town. Roe's done a damned good job setting up the place, and no one can handle the day-to-day details like him.

topics.topic_text: What do you mean, "the big stuff"?
topics.response_text: Life and death matters, putting down thieves, protecting people from raiders who are shortsighted or stupid enough to attack, that sort of thing.

topics.topic_text: How did you get this position?
topics.response_text: I'm about the rarest thing out here in the Wastes: a mercenary who lived long enough to retire.
If you're done asking questions, I'm sure there's something I should be keeping an eye on.
Newcomer to town, huh? Well, I'm Dominic D'Ellsadro, and welcome to Canterbury Commons. Try to ignore the idiots in the costumes.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the AntAgonizer?
topics.response_text: I don't know who she is, other than a crazy with an ant suit and a chip on her shoulder for humanity.{annoyed}

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the Mechanist?
topics.response_text: You mean Scott Wollinksi. I refuse to call him by that ridiculous name just because his head got a screw loose.{feels sorry the guy, but annoyed he's causing problems}

topics.topic_text: Know anything else that could help me stop them?
topics.response_text: If you could just get make either one of them stop fighting, it'd do the trick. You probably wouldn't have to worry about the other one.{amused}

topics.topic: MS02AboutSupersDo you know anything about the AntAgonizer or the Mechanist?
topics.topic_text: What do you know about the AntAgonizer and the Mechanist?
topics.response_text: Roe hired you put a stop to their shit, did he? Guess he finally listened when I told him I haven't got the time to do it myself.{annoyed}

conversation.response_text: Whoa, calm down there. Attitude like that'll just get someone hurt... plus, it puts the locals on edge.
Girl, if you don't relax a little, you're going to snap in half. Now, get going, before you take someone's head off.{Amused by her attitude}
I'll be watching you.{Friendly, very slightly threatening}
We appreciate you taking care of our town's little problem.

description:
Dominic D'Ellsadro is a 48 year-old Hispanic Male.

Dominic "Dom" D'Ellsadro is a weathered but imposing Hispanic man serving as the town guard of Canterbury Commons. With a scar running across his left cheek and eyes that have seen too much of the wasteland, he carries himself with the quiet confidence of a seasoned survivor. His worn leather armor is well-maintained, and he keeps a reliable laser pistol holstered at his side at all times.

Dominic D'Ellsadro's Personality: Disciplined, protective, and wise. Dominic has a no-nonsense approach to security but shows genuine care for those under his protection, especially Machete. He's seen the worst of the wasteland and values community and safety above all else. While he can be stern when enforcing the rules, he's fair and willing to help those in need.

Dominic D'Ellsadro's Backstory: Born in the pre-War United States, Dominic was just a child when the bombs fell in 2077. He spent his formative years in the harsh wastelands, learning to survive from a young age. As a young adult, he formed a small mercenary group, taking on dangerous contracts across the Capital Wasteland. After a particularly harrowing encounter with a raider gang near what would become Canterbury Commons, Dominic decided to retire from the mercenary life. He used the supplies he'd accumulated over the years to establish himself in the budding settlement of Canterbury Commons around 2267. Over the past decade, his natural leadership and combat experience earned him the role of town guard, a position he's held with distinction ever since.
